clinical_study.brief_title: Fire Fighter Fatigue Management Program: Operation Stay Alert
clinical_study.official_title: Fire Fighter Fatigue Management Program: Operation Stay Alert

brief_summary.textblock: Extended duration work shifts and long work weeks have been demonstrated to have adverse effects on health and safety. This phenomenon has not been fully investigated in firefighters, who typically work 24 and 48-hour shifts as well as overtime and often second jobs. The results of this study may lead to recommendations to improve the health, safety, quality of life and performance of firefighters and the safety of the public.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Sleep and health assessment of firefighters using a composite of survey instruments

secondary_outcome.measure: Sleep cycle and work schedule of firefighters measured by a composite of physiological monitoring
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants were involved for up to 3 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Documentation of motor vehicle crashes (MVC), and reported injuries

arm_group.description: Firefighters receive education and health survey in person by a member of our research group.
Firefighters receive education and health survey in person by a member who has been trained by our research group.
Firefighters receive education and health survey online.

intervention.description: All subjects that answer the survey questions indicating that they are at high risk of a sleep disorder will be notified online (e.g., pop-up message and a link to a secure website where the subject can view their survey results confidentially) or by email or a letter.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- This proposal includes research involving human subjects (fire department employees).
- Any employees working or volunteering in fire departments throughout the US will be eligible to participate in the study.
- All applicants will be considered without bias, regardless of race, ethnicity, or national origin.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non fire department employees
